content:
ClientOperation Class

Definition

Used to modify or extend the execution behavior of a specific contract operation in a client object or client channel object. This class cannot be inherited.

In this Article

public sealed class ClientOperation : System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.ClientOperationCompatBase
Inheritance
Object
System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.ClientOperationCompatBase
ClientOperation

Inherited Members

Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()

Remarks

The ClientOperation class is the location for client run-time modifications and insertion point for custom extensions that are scoped to only one service operation. (To modify client run-time behavior for all messages in a contract, use the ClientRuntime class. )

Install ClientOperation modifications using a custom client behavior object, either of type IContractBehavior (to find a particular operation to modify) or of type IOperationBehavior (which can then be applied by creating a custom attribute).

Use the Operations property to locate the ClientOperation object that represents a particular service operation.

For more information about clients and the client architecture, see Accessing Services Using a WCF Client and WCF Client Architecture. For more information about customizing the client runtime, see Extending Clients. For more information about using behaviors, see Configuring and Extending the Runtime with Behaviors.

The following properties enable you to insert custom objects or modify the client execution behavior:

  • Use the Formatter property to insert a custom IClientMessageFormatter implementation for an operation or modify the current formatter.

  • Use the ParameterInspectors property to insert a custom IParameterInspector implementation or to modify the current one.

  • Use the SerializeRequest property to control who serializes an outbound message.

  • Use the DeserializeReply property to control who deserializes an inbound message.

  • Use the Action property to access the WS-Addressing action of the request message and the ReplyAction property to access the response message action.

  • Use the BeginMethod and EndMethod to specify which client methods are associated with an asynchronous operation.

  • Use the FaultContractInfos property to get a collection of specified types that can appear in SOAP faults as the detail type.

  • Use the IsInitiating and IsTerminating properties to control whether a session is initiated or is torn down, respectively, when the operation is called.

  • Use the IsOneWay property to control whether the client waits for a response before completing the invocation.

  • Use the Parent property to obtain the containing ClientRuntime object.

  • Use the Name property to get the name of the operation.

  • Use the SyncMethod property to control which method is mapped to the operation.

Constructors

ClientOperation(ClientRuntime,String,String)

Initializes a new instance of the ClientOperation class using the specified ClientRuntime, name, and action values.

public ClientOperation (System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.ClientRuntime parent, string name, string action);
parent
ClientRuntime

The containing ClientRuntime object.

name
String

The name of the operation.

action
String

The action of the operation.

ClientOperation(ClientRuntime,String,String,String)

Initializes a new instance of the ClientOperation class using the specified ClientRuntime, name, action, and reply action values.

public ClientOperation (System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.ClientRuntime parent, string name, string action, string replyAction);
parent
ClientRuntime

The containing ClientRuntime object.

name
String

The name of the operation.

action
String

The action of the operation.

replyAction
String

The action of the reply message.

Properties

Action

Gets the action of the operation.

public string Action { get; }
Value
String

The action of the operation.

Remarks

By default this value corresponds to the value of Action.

BeginMethod

Gets or sets the method associated with an asynchronous operation.

public System.Reflection.MethodInfo BeginMethod { get; set; }
Value
MethodInfo

A MethodInfo object that represents the method handling the begin portion of an asynchronous method pair, or null if the operation is not part of an asynchronous method pair.

ClientParameterInspectors

Gets a collection of parameter inspector objects used to view or modify parameters prior to or subsequent to a client call.

public System.Collections.Generic.ICollection<System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.IParameterInspector> ClientParameterInspectors { get; }
Value
ICollection<IParameterInspector>

A collection of parameter inspector objects used to view or modify parameters prior to or subsequent to a client call.

Remarks

ClientParameterInspectors is a thread-safe collection.

DeserializeReply

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the stem.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.ClientOperation.Formatter* property value is used to deserialize the reply message.

public bool DeserializeReply { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

trueif the return type is not a Message; otherwise, false.

Remarks

Use the DeserializeReply property to control whether the formatter deserializes the return value from an inbound message or whether the inbound message is returned directly as the return value.

  • Note If false, the return type must be of type Message and there can be no out parameters or an InvalidCastException is thrown at run-time. If the message is null, a InvalidOperationException is thrown at run-time.

EndMethod

Gets or sets the method that implements the asynchronous end method for the operation.

public System.Reflection.MethodInfo EndMethod { get; set; }
Value
MethodInfo

A MethodInfo that represents the end method for the operation, or null if the operation is not asynchronous.

FaultContractInfos

Gets a collection of FaultContractInfo objects that represent the specified SOAP faults for this operation.

public System.Collections.Generic.SynchronizedCollection<System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.FaultContractInfo> FaultContractInfos { get; }
Value
SynchronizedCollection<FaultContractInfo>

A collection of SOAP faults specified for this operation.

Remarks

Use the FaultContractInfos property to get a collection of all contractually specified SOAP faults.

Formatter

Gets or sets the formatter that serializes objects into messages and deserializes messages into objects.

public System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.IClientMessageFormatter Formatter { get; set; }
Value
IClientMessageFormatter

An IClientMessageFormatter implementation.

Remarks

Use the Formatter property to insert a custom IClientMessageFormatter implementation for an operation or modify the current formatter. The use of the formatter can be controlled by the SerializeRequest and DeserializeReply properties.

The IClientMessageFormatter interface defines the SerializeRequest and DeserializeReply methods, which are used to convert a set of object parameters to a message and from a message to a set of return values, respectively.

IsInitiating

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether a session can be started by a message to this operation.

public bool IsInitiating { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if a message to this operation can initiate a session; otherwise, false.

Remarks

By default this value corresponds to the value of IsInitiating.

IsOneWay

Gets or sets a value that indicates if the operation is a one-way operation.

public bool IsOneWay { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the indigo2 client should not expect a reply; otherwise, false. The default value is false.

Remarks

By default this value corresponds to the value of IsOneWay. For issues related to one-way operations, see One-Way Services.

IsTerminating

Gets or sets a value that indicates if this operation is the last one in a session.

public bool IsTerminating { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the associated session is closed after the operation is invoked; otherwise, false.

Remarks

By default this value corresponds to the value of IsTerminating.

Name

Gets the name of the operation.

public string Name { get; }
Value
String

The name of the operation.

Remarks

By default this value corresponds to the value of Name.

ParameterInspectors

Gets or sets a collection of IParameterInspector objects that can inspect and modify inbound and outbound objects for a particular client method.

public System.Collections.Generic.SynchronizedCollection<System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.IParameterInspector> ParameterInspectors { get; }
Value
SynchronizedCollection<IParameterInspector>

A collection of IParameterInspector implementations.

Remarks

Use the ParameterInspectors property to insert a custom IParameterInspector implementation or to modify the current one. Parameter inspectors are invoked in the order in which they are added to the collection for requests and in the reverse order for replies.

Parent

Gets the containing ClientRuntime object.

public System.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.ClientRuntime Parent { get; }
Value
ClientRuntime

The containing ClientRuntime object.

ReplyAction

Gets the action of the reply message for this operation.

public string ReplyAction { get; }
Value
String

The action of the reply.

Remarks

By default this value corresponds to the value of ReplyAction.

SerializeRequest

Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the stem.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.ClientOperation.Formatter* object serializes an outbound message.

public bool SerializeRequest { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the stem.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.ClientOperation.Formatter* property serializes the return values into a reply message; otherwise, false. The default is true.

Remarks

Use the SerializeRequest property to indicate whether the formatter serializes operation parameters into a reply message or to determine if the first parameter is sent as the outbound message.

Note

If set to false, the operation must have exactly one parameter of type Message or an exception is thrown.

SyncMethod

Gets or sets the method that is associated with this operation.

public System.Reflection.MethodInfo SyncMethod { get; set; }
Value
MethodInfo

A MethodInfo that represents the method that implements the operation. If the operation is asynchronous, this value is null and the implementing methods are stored in the stem.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.ClientOperation.BeginMethod* and stem.ServiceModel.Dispatcher.ClientOperation.EndMethod* properties.

TaskMethod

Gets or sets the method associated with a task.

public System.Reflection.MethodInfo TaskMethod { get; set; }
Value
MethodInfo

A MethodInfo object that represents the method associated with a task.

TaskTResult

Gets or sets the type of the result of the method that is associated with a task.

public Type TaskTResult { get; set; }
Value
Type

The Type of the result of the method that is associated with a task.
